data.title: Late night breakfast
data.text: This restaurant stays open 24 hours on Friday and Saturday nights. We stopped in late on way home from airport. Ordered breakfast. I especially enjoyed the biscuits. Bacon, eggs, and hash browns just the way I like them.

data.title: Average Breakfast
data.text: The breakfast is ok for a no frills breakfast. It's more of an older crowd that frequent this place.

data.title: Good food, not a lot of customers
data.text: I had the meatloaf here and it was quite good, home cooking here, but not a lot of customers.  The second time here I had pie and it was good also, but again not many customers.

data.title: Decent food
data.text: I have been twice, both times for breakfast. Basic fare, not memorable. Menu is old fashioned but, seems to be popular with an older crowd. Crowd is local, thus loyalty a big thing here. Food served hot, to order. Prices decent. Parking is not plentiful and can be tricky to get in and out of because of location at corner of intersection

data.title: A handful of visits
data.text: This restaurant has a wide spectrum of reviews.  I always look at the dates of the reviews to get an idea if the bad is current or in the past.  I've only eaten breakfast here and I've visited 6 times.  Overall the breakfast meals are what I'd call average to average plus.  The servings are adequate and have always been hot and cooked how I ordered.  The cream gravy is a little on the weak side for a mix, I suspect, but above par for the course for most restaurants.  I could be wrong but the biscuits seemed to be the already cooked and reheated type and did not taste to be freshly baked.  A simple buttermilk or heavy cream biscuit recipe is 4-6 ingredients and not difficult to make or time consuming.  I'll visit again and if you are in the area and hungry for a sit down traditional American breakfast, give it a try.  You may think the quality is better than my rating.  More of a home town restaurant atmosphere as the times I've visited there are people at different tables who speak to each other.  Worth a try.  I've eaten pancakes and bacon, eggs and bacon with crispy hashbrowns the way I like them and I've ordered the chicken fried steak breakfast a couple of times.  The prices are reasonable and I leave full but not stuffed.  The waitstaff has always been attentive but not overly so and average temperaments.

data.title: Nice waitresses
data.text: Good breakfasts and nice waitresses.  We wanted to come back for the vegetable plate but were not able to make it back.  They have grits and hash browns the latter were good could have been a little crisper.

data.title: Horrible food
data.text: I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a good meal. The food is cheap, greasy and it looks like it was thrown onto the plates. it is disgusting!

data.title: Cute name
data.text: If you want something different from Denny's or Ihop, this can be your place to stop by. It's not the best but not the worse. Portions seem to be bigger ten years ago. But around this part of town,its cute enough and  it's ok to me.

data.title: Busy bee for the first timr
data.text: Tried this place for the first time.  I had chicken fried steak, baked potato and salad while my husband had cheeseburger and fries. As always, we picked from each other's food to get a taste of it all. The salad was so-so but everything else was deli! The chicken fried steak was huge, we couldn't finish but half . Nevertheless, The burger & fries is  what gave this place 5 stars from us! 👍🏼

data.title: The struggle.....
data.text: I want to like this place.  It has a great location and a nontraditional look to it.  The service was subpar and the food was bland.  It just wasn't happening.

data.title: Highky disappointing
data.text: . Not worth the expense nor the wait. Awful so called "home cooking" and meager portions. Pies are store bought or at least taste like one. Service is O.K. but rather slow, taking in to consideration the place was empty.

data.title: Just went for the pies!
data.text: I went to pick up a couple of their pies, which are VERY good. There were a lot of people at the restaurant, which has a good reputation.

data.title: Meet Here for Breakfast
data.text: We  have been going to the Busy Bee for years and are never disappointed.  The breakfast menu is especially good with a large variety of delicious dishes.

data.title: Acceptable, not great
data.text: Usually not very busy. Service is average. Average food. Okay if other restaurants are crowded and you want quieter.

data.title: A total surprise ...
data.text: ... And a very welcome find amongst so many franchised establishments. Easy to find, very welcoming and friendly staff and an extensive menu offering some plain honest home cooking.

data.title: Service could have been better
data.text:
I was hoping our bunch of grandkids didn't scare off our waitress cause she didn't check on us very often-

If you like kielbasa sausage - this place gives mega portions on main entrees and breakfasts. Still there were only 4 slices of fried green tomatoes at $2.79 geeee
Mac and cheese good but broccoli really over cooled.

Chocolate cream pie was nice but meringue has marshmallow  taste.

All okaybut not terrific

data.title: Unassuming but good
data.text: This was our first time  visiting this restaurant. Stopped in for breakfast when we could not get into the local Waffle House. The breakfast was good. The service was warm and friendly. Country comfort. Could be cleaner.

data.title: Great Smothered Biscuits, Skip the Chicken Fried Steak!
data.text: I have to admit I went the glutton route for this visit. My first time to an establishment much lauded by my mother made me really, really keen on trying the CFS. I have to say I was super disappointed in that regard -- the breading was doughy and had an almost acidic aftertast to it (weird!). But this didn't ruin my trip! My daughters had excellent pancakes shaped into Mickey Mouse faces, and I very much enjoyed my smothered biscuits (biscuits, country gravy, scrambled eggs, diced sausage!). The decor is quaint and appropriate to the locale, the service swift and with a smile. Greatly recommended for a one time tourist trip, or an every Sunday family get together!

data.title: Great breakfast, but ants crawling on the walls
data.text: We stopped in for a quick breakfast on Saturday and got our usual service and good food.  However, we discovered there were ants crawling over the wall where we sat.  I looked around a bit and found bits of food behind the napkin dispenser on the table where they were flocking too.  Also bits of found on the ground between the seat and wall.  Definitely need to clean better!

data.title: Pretty good breakfast spot
data.text:
We stopped in for a good quick breakfast and weren't disappointed.  All of the typical offerings that you can imagine are available on the menu.  I did try the breakfast quesadilla and it was pretty dang good.  The cinnamon roll was great, well at least half of it was.  The other half was hard from them microwaving it too much.  

Pretty good food and mediocre service.  I don't expect much more from a cheap breakfast place however.
